Evelyn.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

Roy.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

Billy.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

Gregory.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

Vincent.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

Philip.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints.

private_information: preference: would rather not meet after 13:30 on Monday
William.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' schedules and constraints, respecting personal preferences.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' PDDL outputs and produce a combined FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that schedules a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 satisfying all constraints and preferences while keeping agents' actions distinct.

public_information: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants must attend the same 30-minute slot
Participants have existing busy intervals that cannot be used
William prefers not to meet after 13:30 but it is a preference not an absolute block
There exists at least one feasible meeting time that satisfies everyone

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems and produce FastDownward-compatible PDDL. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Evelyn. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->Evelyn->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->Evelyn->goal} Think step by step and provide a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represents your constraints and a plan to schedule a 30-minute meeting. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and produce FastDownward-compatible PDDL. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and model a joint schedule that respects each agent's constraints and preferences.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are seven participant agents providing PDDL domains and problems that capture their individual busy times. Integrate their PDDL responses to produce a combined FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that schedules a single 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 satisfying all hard constraints and respecting preferences where possible. Keep all agents' actions distinct and resolve naming mismatches or partial information. Here is the information from each agent: {pddl_Evelyn} {pddl_Roy} {pddl_Billy} {pddl_Gregory} {pddl_Vincent} {pddl_Philip} {pddl_William} Think step by step and provide the integrated PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
